intro: Orthosiphon persimilis, commonly known as the slender horsegram, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, arranged in whorled clusters along the stem. Orthosiphon persimilis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
